projects.title: Terraform AWS Provider
projects.bodyText: A provider in Terraform is a plugin that enables interaction with an API. This includes Cloud providers such as AWS. The AWS Provider for Terraform allows you to manage and deploy resources to AWS. I have contributed features and bug fixes to this Open Source project used by millions globally.

projects.title: Chaos Toolkit AZ Failure Extension for AWS
projects.bodyText: This project is a collection of actions, gathered as an extension to the Chaos Toolkit to simulate an Availability Zone (AZ) failure across multiple AWS services for you to test the resiliency of your hosted applications. This project is purposefully built for simulating AZ failures.

projects.title: Campus Shuttle Mobile App
projects.bodyText: Mobile app for viewing bus timings on campus and routes.

projects.title: NAS
projects.bodyText: Network Access Service is a collection of Cloud Native Go microservices and event driven workers for providing allow list requests of AWS WAF through HTTP APIs.

projects.title: Scheduled switch for Terraform managed resources on AWS
projects.bodyText: This Terraform module allows you to apply a pattern of scheduled EventBridge events to manage your Terraform resources. It could be used to simply create, update or destroy resources on schedule. An example where this pattern could be applied to is when you have Terraform managed resources that are incurring costs during unutilized periods of time. Such a solution to spin resources up and down on schedule could help with significant cost savings.

projects.title: Progressive Delivery in Amazon EKS using Argo Rollouts
projects.bodyText: Sample containerized application and Kubernetes infrastructure for metrics driven progressive delivery showcase with blue/green and canary deployments.

projects.title: Timetable Constraint Solver on AWS Lambda
projects.bodyText: A sample serverless project for deploying a Java constraint solver by OptaPlanner as a container on AWS Lambda.
